714943f-a.text:
E. 101st Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Madison Avenue (foreground ) as viewed north eastward across a vacant lot at the S.E. corner. Buildings to the left extend northward on the east side of the avenue. Note the hospital sign on the corner lamp-post indicating the proximity of Mt. Sinai Hospital which is to the rear of the photographer.
September 14, 1938.
P.L. Sperr

721459f-a.text:
1470 to 1476 Madison Avenue, at, adjoining and north of the N.W. corner of E. 101st Street as viewed northwestward from a clearance at the S.E. corner. Note the Madison Avenue Bus on that thoroughfare.
September 14, 1938.
P.L. Sperr

714944f-a.text:
101st and 102nd Streets from Madison to 5th Ave.
Squatters - Old N.Y.
Photo By
Brown Brothers
220 West 42nd St.
New York City

721456f-a.text:
Madison Avenue (left, not seen) at the S. N. corner of East 101st Street, showing rural conditions. Data on the reverse side of this print is: Amsterdam Avenue and 100th Street, September 21, 1894. A companion view to this was published in the N. Y. Sun of February 11, 1929 as No. 122 in their series titled "Old N. Y. in Pictures".
Mr. Hoffman of the N. Y. H. S. corrects this location and bases his conclusions on a view taken from atop the Ruppert house at 5th Avenue and 93rd Street.
1894
H. N. Tiemann, photo
Gtft of Urbrock Collection

721457f-a.text:
Madison Avenue (left, not seen), at the S.W. corner of E. 101st Street, showing a squatter colony occupying the block bounded by 101st and 100th Streets, Madison to Fifth Avenues. The photographer is viewing southwestward towards Central Park which borders on the far side of the latter thoroughfare. Note the unpaved condition of 101st Street. A companion view to this was published in the New York Sun of February 11, 1929 as No. 122 in the series titled "Old N.Y. in Pictures" and gave as the location, Amsterdam Avenue at 100th Street. Mr. Hoffman of the New York Historical Society identifies same as the above and bases his statement on the vista seen in a photograph taken atop the Ruppert house at Fifth avenue and 97th Street. This organization has both views in their files.
H. N. Tiemann Company  1894.
Brown Brothers
